import tkinter as tk
from tkinter import ttk, messagebox
from data_management import validate_email, validate_age, save_data, load_data
from models import Student, Instructor, Course
import csv
import sqlite3
from tkinter.filedialog import asksaveasfilename
from database import create_database, add_student, add_instructor, add_course, fetch_students, fetch_instructors, fetch_courses, update_student, update_instructor, update_course, delete_student, delete_instructor, delete_course, fetch_registered_students

"""
School Management System Application using Tkinter.

This module defines a school management system where users can manage students, instructors, and courses.
The application provides a graphical user interface (GUI) to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete)
operations on students, instructors, and courses. Users can register students to courses, search records,
export data to CSV files, and save or load the data from JSON files.

Classes:
    SchoolManagementSystemApp(QMainWindow): Main window of the school management system. Provides functionality
    for managing students, instructors, and courses, as well as registering students in courses.
"""

class SchoolManagementSystemApp:
    """
    Main window for the School Management System Application using TK.

    This class provides the main functionality for managing students, instructors, courses, and student registrations.
    Users can add, edit, delete, search, and display students, instructors, and courses. Additionally, the class
    supports saving and loading data from JSON files, exporting to CSV, and viewing registered students per course.

    Attributes:
        students (list): List of students currently loaded from the database.
        instructors (list): List of instructors currently loaded from the database.
        courses (list): List of courses currently loaded from the database.
    """
    def __init__(self, root):
        """
        Initializes the School Management System application.

        Args:
            root (Tk): The root window for the Tkinter application.
        """
        self.root = root
        self.root.title("School Management System")
        self.root.state('zoomed')  # Fullscreen

        self.root.config(background='#f0f0f0')
        
        # Initialize database
        create_database()

        self.style = ttk.Style()
        self.style.theme_use('clam')
        self.style.configure('TButton', font=('Helvetica', 10, 'bold'), foreground='#ffffff', background='#5c85d6')
        self.style.configure('TLabel', font=('Helvetica', 10), padding=5)
        self.style.configure('Treeview', font=('Helvetica', 10), rowheight=25)
        self.style.configure('TEntry', padding=5)

        self.root.grid_rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
        self.root.grid_columnconfigure(0, weight=1)

        self.setup_gui()
        self.load_data()

    def setup_gui(self):
        """
        Sets up the GUI layout for the School Management System.

        This method initializes the main layout, including the tabbed sections for students, instructors,
        courses, and registration forms.
        """
        header = tk.Label(self.root, text="School Management System", font=("Helvetica", 16, "bold"), bg="#4CAF50", fg="white", padx=10, pady=10)
        header.grid(row=0, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="ew", pady=10)

        self.notebook = ttk.Notebook(self.root)
        self.notebook.grid(row=1, column=0, columnspan=2, sticky="nsew", padx=10, pady=10)

        self.root.grid_rowconfigure(1, weight=1)
        self.root.grid_columnconfigure(0, weight=1)

        self.student_frame = tk.Frame(self.notebook, bg='#f0f0f0')
        self.instructor_frame = tk.Frame(self.notebook, bg='#f0f0f0')
        self.course_frame = tk.Frame(self.notebook, bg='#f0f0f0')
        self.registration_frame = tk.Frame(self.notebook, bg='#f0f0f0')

        self.notebook.add(self.student_frame, text="Students")
        self.notebook.add(self.instructor_frame, text="Instructors")
        self.notebook.add(self.course_frame, text="Courses")
        self.notebook.add(self.registration_frame, text="Student Registration")

        self.student_frame.grid_columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
        self.instructor_frame.grid_columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
        self.course_frame.grid_columnconfigure(1, weight=1)
        self.registration_frame.grid_columnconfigure(1, weight=1)

        self.setup_student_form()
        self.setup_instructor_form()
        self.setup_course_form()
        self.setup_registration_form()  
        self.setup_display_records()  # Add scrollable table with reduced height
        self.setup_switch_buttons()  # Display related buttons with search on the same row
        self.setup_data_buttons()  # Place all data-related buttons at the bottom

    def setup_display_records(self):
        """
        Set up the main table to display records of students, instructors, and courses.

        This method creates a QTableWidget to display records, which will be populated by
        the load_data method with student, instructor, and course data.

        Parameters:
        """
        frame = ttk.Frame(self.root)
        frame.grid(row=3, column=0, columnspan=2, padx=10, pady=10, sticky="nsew")

        scrollbar_y = ttk.Scrollbar(frame, orient="vertical")
        scrollbar_x = ttk.Scrollbar(frame, orient="horizontal")

        self.treeview = ttk.Treeview(frame, columns=("ID", "Name", "Email", "Age"), show="headings", 
                                     yscrollcommand=scrollbar_y.set, xscrollcommand=scrollbar_x.set, height=6)

        self.treeview.heading("ID", text="Student ID", anchor=tk.W)
        self.treeview.heading("Name", text="Name", anchor=tk.W)
        self.treeview.heading("Email", text="Email", anchor=tk.W)
        self.treeview.heading("Age", text="Age", anchor=tk.W)

        self.treeview.column("ID", width=100, minwidth=80, anchor=tk.W)
        self.treeview.column("Name", width=150, minwidth=120, anchor=tk.W)
        self.treeview.column("Email", width=200, minwidth=150, anchor=tk.W)
        self.treeview.column("Age", width=80, minwidth=50, anchor=tk.W)

        self.treeview.grid(row=0, column=0, sticky="nsew")

        scrollbar_y.config(command=self.treeview.yview)
        scrollbar_x.config(command=self.treeview.xview)

        scrollbar_y.grid(row=0, column=1, sticky="ns")
        scrollbar_x.grid(row=1, column=0, sticky="ew")

        frame.grid_rowconfigure(0, weight=1)
        frame.grid_columnconfigure(0, weight=1)

    def export_to_csv(self):
        """
    Export the current students, instructors, and courses data to a CSV file.

    The user is prompted to choose a location and filename to save the CSV file.
    The data is exported in three sections: Students, Instructors, and Courses, each with its own
    set of column headers and data rows.

    - Students: Includes student ID, name, email, and age.
    - Instructors: Includes instructor ID, name, email, and age.
    - Courses: Includes course ID, course name, instructor name, and a list of registered student IDs.

    If the export is successful, a message box is displayed to confirm the export.

    Raises:
        None
    """
        # Ask user to specify the file path for saving the CSV
        file_path = asksaveasfilename(defaultextension=".csv", filetypes=[("CSV files", "*.csv")])
        
        if file_path:
            with open(file_path, 'w', newline='') as file:
                writer = csv.writer(file)

                # Export Students
                writer.writerow(["Students"])  # Section header
                writer.writerow(["Student ID", "Name", "Email", "Age"])  # Column headers
                for student in self.students:
                    writer.writerow([student.student_id, student.name, student._email, student.age])

                writer.writerow([])  # Empty row for separation

                # Export Instructors
                writer.writerow(["Instructors"])  # Section header
                writer.writerow(["Instructor ID", "Name", "Email", "Age"])  # Column headers
                for instructor in self.instructors:
                    writer.writerow([instructor.instructor_id, instructor.name, instructor._email, instructor.age])

                writer.writerow([])  # Empty row for separation

                # Export Courses
                writer.writerow(["Courses"])  # Section header
                writer.writerow(["Course ID", "Course Name", "Instructor Name", "Registered Students (IDs)"])  # Column headers
                for course in self.courses:
                    student_ids = ", ".join([student.student_id for student in course.students])  # List student IDs
                    writer.writerow([course.course_id, course.course_name, course.instructor.name, student_ids])

            messagebox.showinfo("Export Successful", f"Data successfully exported to {file_path}")

    def show_instructors(self):
        """
    Display a new window with a list of all instructors in the system.

    The window includes a table displaying instructor details such as:
    - ID
    - Name
    - Email
    - Age

    A search feature is also provided to filter instructors based on the search query.

    Raises:
        None
    """
        instructors_popup = tk.Toplevel(self.root)
        instructors_popup.title("Instructors List")
        instructors_popup.geometry("600x400")

        # Fetch instructors from the database
        instructors = fetch_instructors()

        search_frame = ttk.Frame(instructors_popup)
        search_frame.pack(pady=10)
        search_label = ttk.Label(search_frame, text="Search Instructors")
        search_label.grid(row=0, column=0, padx=5)
        search_entry = ttk.Entry(search_frame)
        search_entry.grid(row=0, column=1, padx=5)
        search_button = ttk.Button(search_frame, text="Search", command=lambda: self.search_instructors(treeview, search_entry.get()))
        search_button.grid(row=0, column=2, padx=5)

        treeview = ttk.Treeview(instructors_popup, columns=("ID", "Name", "Email", "Age"), show="headings")
        treeview.column("ID", width=150, minwidth=100, anchor=tk.W)
        treeview.column("Name", width=200, minwidth=100, anchor=tk.W)
        treeview.column("Email", width=250, minwidth=150, anchor=tk.W)
        treeview.column("Age", width=100, minwidth=50, anchor=tk.W)

        treeview.heading("ID", text="ID", anchor=tk.W)
        treeview.heading("Name", text="Name", anchor=tk.W)
        treeview.heading("Email", text="Email", anchor=tk.W)
        treeview.heading("Age", text="Age", anchor=tk.W)

        for instructor in instructors:
            # Assuming instructor is a tuple with the format (ID, Name, Email, Age)
            treeview.insert("", "end", values=(instructor[0], instructor[1], instructor[2], instructor[3]))

        treeview.pack(fill="both", expand=True)

    def search_instructors(self, treeview, search_query):
        """
    Search for instructors in the system based on a search query.

    Filters the list of instructors by checking if the search query matches the instructor's ID or name.
    Updates the provided table widget with the filtered results.

    Parameters:
        table_widget (QTableWidget): The table to display the filtered instructors.
        search_query (str): The query used to search for instructors by name or ID.
    """
        for record in treeview.get_children():
            treeview.delete(record)

        for instructor in self.instructors:
            if search_query.lower() in instructor.name.lower() or search_query.lower() in instructor.instructor_id.lower():
                treeview.insert("", "end", values=(instructor.instructor_id, instructor.name, instructor._email, instructor.age))

    def search_courses(self, treeview, search_query):
        """
    Search for courses in the system based on a search query.

    Filters the list of courses by checking if the search query matches the course's ID or name.
    Updates the provided table widget with the filtered results.

    Parameters:
        table_widget (QTableWidget): The table to display the filtered courses.
        search_query (str): The query used to search for courses by name or ID.
    """
        for record in treeview.get_children():
            treeview.delete(record)

        for course in self.courses:
            if search_query.lower() in course.course_name.lower() or search_query.lower() in course.course_id.lower():
                treeview.insert("", "end", values=(course.course_id, course.course_name, course.instructor.name))

    def show_registered_students(self):
        """
    Display a new window with the list of students registered for the selected course.

    After selecting a course from the dropdown, this method fetches the students registered for that course
    and displays them in a popup window. If no students are registered for the course, an information message is shown.

    Raises:
        None
    """
        course_name = self.view_course_combo.get()
        
        # Fetch courses from the database
        courses = fetch_courses()

        course = next((c for c in courses if c[1] == course_name), None)  # Course name is at index 1

        if course:
            student_popup = tk.Toplevel(self.root)
            student_popup.title(f"Students Registered for {course_name}")
            student_popup.geometry("600x400")

            treeview = ttk.Treeview(student_popup, columns=("ID", "Name", "Email", "Age"), show="headings")

            treeview.column("ID", width=150, minwidth=100, anchor=tk.W)
            treeview.column("Name", width=200, minwidth=100, anchor=tk.W)
            treeview.column("Email", width=250, minwidth=150, anchor=tk.W)
            treeview.column("Age", width=100, minwidth=50, anchor=tk.W)

            treeview.heading("ID", text="ID", anchor=tk.W)
            treeview.heading("Name", text="Name", anchor=tk.W)
            treeview.heading("Email", text="Email", anchor=tk.W)
            treeview.heading("Age", text="Age", anchor=tk.W)

            # Fetch registered students for the selected course
            registered_students = fetch_registered_students(course[0])  # Assuming course[0] is Course ID

            for student in registered_students:
                # Assuming student is a tuple with (ID, Name, Email, Age)
                treeview.insert("", "end", values=(student[0], student[1], student[2], student[3]))

            treeview.pack(fill="both", expand=True)
        else:
            messagebox.showerror("Error", "Please select a valid course.")
        self.popup.destroy()

    def clear_treeview(self):
        """
    Clear the given QTableWidget by removing all rows.

    This method is useful when switching views or refreshing data in the table.

    Parameters:
        table_widget (QTableWidget): The table to be cleared of all rows.
    """
        for record in self.treeview.get_children():
            self.treeview.delete(record)

    def setup_search(self):
        """

        Creates a search bar and a button to trigger the search. The search filters through

        self.search_button = ttk.Button(search_frame, text="Search", command=self.search_records)
        self.search_button.grid(row=0, column=2, padx=5)

    def add_student(self):
        """
    Add a new student to the system.

    This method retrieves the student's name, age, email, and ID from the form,
    and attempts to add the student to the database using the `add_student` function.
    If the student ID already exists in the database, an error message is shown.

    Raises:
        sqlite3.IntegrityError: If the student ID already exists in the database.
    """
        name = self.student_name.get()
        age = self.student_age.get()
        email = self.student_email.get()
        student_id = self.student_id.get()

        if validate_email(email) and validate_age(int(age)):
            try:
                # Add student to the database
                add_student(student_id, name, int(age), email)
                self.treeview.insert("", "end", values=(student_id, name, email, age))
                self.update_comboboxes()
            except sqlite3.IntegrityError:
                messagebox.showerror("Error", "Student ID already exists in the database.")
        else:
            messagebox.showerror("Invalid Data", "Please provide valid email and age")

    def add_course(self):
        """
    Add a new course to the system.

    This method retrieves the course's name, ID, and instructor's name from the form.
    It fetches the instructor's ID from the list of instructors and adds the course to the database
    using the `add_course` function. If the instructor is not found, an error message is shown.

    Raises:
    """
        course_id = self.course_id.get()
        course_name = self.course_name.get()
        instructor_name = self.course_instructor.get()

        # Fetch instructor ID from the database
        instructor = next((i for i in fetch_instructors() if i[1] == instructor_name), None)

        if instructor:
            try:
                # Add course to the database
                add_course(course_id, course_name, instructor[0])  # Use instructor ID from the database
                self.treeview.insert("", "end", values=(course_id, course_name))
                self.update_comboboxes()
            except sqlite3.IntegrityError:
                messagebox.showerror("Error", "Course ID already exists in the database.")
        else:
            messagebox.showerror("Invalid Instructor", "Instructor not found")





[docs]
    def register_student(self):
        """
    Register a student for a course.

    This method retrieves the student's name and the course name from the dropdown menus.
    It fetches the corresponding student and course records and attempts to insert a registration
    record into the `registrations` table in the database. If the student is already registered for
    the course, an error message is shown.

    Raises:
        sqlite3.IntegrityError: If the student is already registered for the course.
    """
        student_name = self.registration_student.get()
        course_name = self.registration_course.get()

        # Fetch student and course IDs from the database
        student = next((s for s in fetch_students() if s[1] == student_name), None)
        course = next((c for c in fetch_courses() if c[1] == course_name), None)

        if student and course:
            try:
                conn = sqlite3.connect('school_management.db')
                cursor = conn.cursor()
                cursor.execute('INSERT INTO registrations (student_id, course_id) VALUES (?, ?)', 
                            (student[0], course[0]))  # Use student_id and course_id
                conn.commit()  # Commit the transaction
                messagebox.showinfo("Success", f"Student {student_name} registered for {course_name}")
            except sqlite3.IntegrityError:
                messagebox.showerror("Error", "This student is already registered for the course.")
            finally:
                conn.close()  # Always close the connection
        else:
            messagebox.showerror("Error", "Invalid student or course.")

    def assign_instructor(self):
        """
    Assign an instructor to a course.

    This method retrieves the course name and instructor name from the form.
    It fetches the corresponding course and instructor objects from the system
    and assigns the instructor to the course. If the course or instructor is not found,
    an error message is shown.

    Raises:
    """
        course_name = self.course_name.get()
        instructor_name = self.course_instructor.get()

        course = next((c for c in self.courses if c.course_name == course_name), None)
        instructor = next((i for i in self.instructors if i.name == instructor_name), None)

        if course and instructor:
            course.assign_instructor(instructor)
            messagebox.showinfo("Success", f"Instructor {instructor_name} assigned to {course_name}")
        else:
            messagebox.showerror("Error", "Invalid instructor or course")

    def search_records(self):
        """
    Search and filter student records based on user input.

    This method retrieves the search query entered by the user, clears the current table,
    and populates the table with student records whose ID or name matches the search query.

    Raises:
        None
    """
        search_query = self.search_entry.get().lower()
        self.clear_treeview()  # Clear the table before inserting new results

        # Search students in the database
        conn = sqlite3.connect('school_management.db')
        cursor = conn.cursor()
        cursor.execute("SELECT * FROM students WHERE LOWER(name) LIKE ? OR LOWER(student_id) LIKE ?", 
                    (f"%{search_query}%", f"%{search_query}%"))
        students = cursor.fetchall()
        conn.close()

        for student in students:
            self.treeview.insert("", "end", values=(student[0], student[1], student[3], student[2]))

    def refresh_data(self):
        """
    Load the saved data from a JSON file and refresh the application tables and comboboxes.

    This method reads data from 'school_data.json' and populates the application with saved students,
    instructors, and courses. It updates the table and comboboxes accordingly. If no saved data is found,
    a warning message is displayed.
    
    Raises:
        FileNotFoundError: If the 'school_data.json' file is not found.
    """
        self.treeview.delete(*self.treeview.get_children())  # Clear current data

        # Fetch new data from the database
        students = fetch_students()
        instructors = fetch_instructors()
        courses = fetch_courses()

        # Repopulate the treeview and combo boxes
        for student in students:
            self.treeview.insert("", "end", values=(student[0], student[1], student[3], student[2]))

        self.update_comboboxes(students, instructors, courses)
        messagebox.showinfo("Refresh Complete", "Data has been refreshed")

    def update_comboboxes(self, students=None, instructors=None, courses=None):
        """
    Update the values in the comboboxes for students, instructors, and courses.

    This method updates the comboboxes with the latest students, instructors, and courses from the system
    to be used in forms for registration, adding courses, and other operations.
    """
        if not students:
            students = fetch_students()
        if not instructors:
            instructors = fetch_instructors()
        if not courses:
            courses = fetch_courses()

        student_names = [s[1] for s in students]  # Assuming second element is student name
        self.registration_student['values'] = student_names

        instructor_names = [i[1] for i in instructors]  # Assuming second element is instructor name
        self.course_instructor['values'] = instructor_names

        course_names = [c[1] for c in courses]  # Assuming second element is course name
        self.registration_course['values'] = course_names

    def edit_record(self):
        """
    Edit the selected record (student, instructor, or course) in the database.

    This method retrieves the selected record from the table, checks if it is a student, instructor, 
    or course, and calls the appropriate edit method to allow the user to modify the record.

    Raises:
    """
        selected_item = self.treeview.selection()
        if not selected_item:
            messagebox.showerror("Error", "Please select a record to edit")
            return

        item_values = self.treeview.item(selected_item, "values")

        # Fetch the student, instructor, or course by ID from the database
        students = fetch_students()
        instructors = fetch_instructors()
        courses = fetch_courses()

        student = next((s for s in students if s[0] == item_values[0]), None)
        instructor = next((i for i in instructors if i[0] == item_values[0]), None)
        course = next((c for c in courses if c[0] == item_values[0]), None)

        if student:
            self.edit_student(student)
        elif instructor:
            self.edit_instructor(instructor)
        elif course:
            self.edit_course(course)

    def edit_student(self, student):
        """
    Populate the student form with the selected student's data for editing.

    Args:
        student (tuple): A tuple representing the selected student's data, 
                         containing (student_id, name, age, email).

    The method fills in the fields of the student form with the student's information, 
    disables the student ID field (to prevent changing it), and changes the "Add Student" button 
    to "Update Student" with a new command to update the student.
    """
        # student is a tuple, access its fields by index
        self.student_name.delete(0, tk.END)
        self.student_name.insert(0, student[1])  # student[1] is the name
        self.student_age.delete(0, tk.END)
        self.student_age.insert(0, student[2])  # student[2] is the age
        self.student_email.delete(0, tk.END)
        self.student_email.insert(0, student[3])  # student[3] is the email
        self.student_id.delete(0, tk.END)
        self.student_id.insert(0, student[0])  # student[0] is the student_id

        # Disable the student ID field
        self.student_id.config(state="disabled")

        self.add_student_button.config(text="Update Student", command=lambda: self.update_student(student))

    def edit_course(self, course):
        """
    Populate the course form with the selected course's data for editing.

    Args:
        course (Course): A Course object representing the selected course.

    def update_student(self, student):
        """
    Update the selected student's data in the database and in the TreeView.

    Args:
        student (tuple): A tuple representing the selected student's data, 
                         containing (student_id, name, age, email).

    The method retrieves the updated student data from the form fields, updates the 
    student's information in the database, and updates the corresponding row in the TreeView.
    After the update, the "Update Student" button is reset to "Add Student," and the 
    student ID field is re-enabled.
    """
        student_id = self.student_id.get()
        name = self.student_name.get()
        age = int(self.student_age.get())
        email = self.student_email.get()

        # Update the student record in the database
        update_student(student_id, name, age, email)

        # Update the selected item in the TreeView
        selected_item = self.treeview.selection()[0]
        self.treeview.item(selected_item, values=(student_id, name, email, age))

        # Reset the button text to "Add Student" after update
        self.add_student_button.config(text="Add Student", command=self.add_student)

        # Re-enable the student ID field for future additions
        self.student_id.config(state="normal")

        messagebox.showinfo("Updated", "Student updated successfully")

    def update_instructor(self, instructor):

    def update_course(self, course):
        """
    Update the selected course's data in the database and in the TreeView.

    Args:
        course (Course): A Course object representing the course to be updated.

    The method retrieves the updated course data from the form fields, including the selected

        self.add_course_button.config(text="Add Course", command=self.add_course)
        messagebox.showinfo("Updated", "Course updated successfully")

    def delete_record(self):
        """
    Delete the selected record (student, instructor, or course) from the database.

    This method identifies the selected record in the table, fetches the corresponding data 
    from the database (either a student, instructor, or course), and deletes it. After deletion,
    the table is refreshed with the remaining records.

    Raises:
        None"""
        selected_item = self.treeview.selection()
        if not selected_item:
            messagebox.showerror("Error", "Please select a record to delete")
            return

        item_values = self.treeview.item(selected_item, "values")
        student_id = item_values[0]  # Assuming the first value is the student/instructor/course ID

        # Delete the record from the database
        if any(s for s in fetch_students() if s[0] == student_id):
            delete_student(student_id)
        elif any(i for i in fetch_instructors() if i[0] == student_id):
            delete_instructor(student_id)
        elif any(c for c in fetch_courses() if c[0] == student_id):
            delete_course(student_id)

        self.treeview.delete(selected_item)
        messagebox.showinfo("Deleted", "Record deleted successfully")
